author: Cindy Soto
content: Why is it sooo hard to just jump on board with this?? üòû any tips?

replies.content: You need to break meni life long habits. It is hard but if you are persistent it is doable.

After being diagnosed with type 1 diabetes, I sought alternative approaches and discovered Dr. Oremire's herbal medicine. Embracing a holistic approach to my condition, I followed his prescribed herbal remedies, which had a remarkable impact on my heal‚Ä¶ See more
Just do it. Clean out the fridge, cabinets, and pantry of everything not carnivore and watch YouTube videos by Dr Ken D Berry, MD and Dr Chaffee.
Its best to start with Keto-vore then ease into Carnivore if it's tough for you

Chris Rivers Can also supplement with protein shakes but make sure they don‚Äôt have any sugar. Monkfruit ok .
And keep an eye out for Maltodextrin it‚Äôs an artificial sugar that worse for you than cane sugar and does a worse number on insulin resistance.

John Ouillette my protein shakes have munk fruit and coconut sugar. Total 2g and the rest are various mushrooms with protein from: pea protein. Hemp. Chis. Pumpkin coconut. All the naughty seeds. Lol. I‚Äôd like to give what I have away.

Jumping on board isn't necessarily for everyone. I personally find that if I jump into something without proper preparation and understanding, I fail before I even begin. But that's me.
I find that what works for me is a slower, steady approach. I beg‚Ä¶ See more

Erin Burke I‚Äôm still struggling with healthy. My training as optimal health practitioner is having trouble regarding this as healthy. But I‚Äôm very intrigued and want to give it a try. If it‚Äôs as good as I hope then I can recommend to my clients. I have‚Ä¶ See more

Janet Pirozzi may I suggest reading (if this group will allow it) Anyway You can, as well as ketoCONTINUUM by Dr Annette Bosworth.
Knowing what is healthy for the body is about understanding how the body works and thinks. These two books share the bio‚Ä¶ See more
Erin Burke thx! They‚Äôre in my queue.
It's all about self control or self discipline no matter what way of eating you choose
Doing the same thing over and expecting a different result is the definition of insanity. If it‚Äôs not working, try a different approach. Ease in, it‚Äôs likely better that way anyway.

Yes, make a plan, work the plan... Success doesn't just happen. https://youtu.be/p9a9sF6HCi0

It‚Äôs not your just that programmed. So many foods and ingredients just aren‚Äôt food and we were all fooled into consuming them. Start slow and build into it.
It's really difficult to start, super easy once the cravings stop
Because you don‚Äôt really want to do it. You want to try it but you don‚Äôt really want to commit. It‚Äôs not hard you just don‚Äôt want to put in any effort to change how you‚Äôre eating.

I‚Äôm only on week two, but I started by setting a date, shopping the day before, telling my husband what I was doing then starting the next morning. Had headaches until someone told me drink bone broth. So far so goodüôè
Cindy Soto not hard just eat more fat and meat and less carbs and sugar
Because you still believe all the lies you were told.
100% will power.

Do a gradual conversion? That's what I did. I could not justify tossing all the non-carnivore food. I stopped buying it & cut down to meat with 1 side dish. When the sides were used up, I was gradually converted to carnivore. Felt great the whole time.
Found it easy just decided what day planned and started ,I'm now day 4 and even doing 12 hour shifts I'm finding it very easy so far .
I recommend trying and trying. I started a bit slow. Made sure I ended all my cravings (it did work for me). Within 1 week I was on board
Find a reason why that you can stick with
Jump in head first OMAD. It‚Äôs hard for a couple weeks but the results you see and feel are beyond worth the hardship you have to go through the only obstacle for me is funding üòÖüòÖ
For me it was 45y of conditioning. Bad habits die hard.

I was Keto first so the next step wasn‚Äôt that hard. Just had cravings for a couple of days then fine - probably best to start on stages, low carb before 0 carb. By wow the dramatic fast weight loss effects will keep you going once on board - it‚Äôs liter‚Ä¶ See more

Mind of matter of what we have been told and taught. A very mental challenge giving up food that we loved so much and made us fat. The choice to be healthy and strong goes with for me giving up my icecream, and never having it again. By choice to be he‚Ä¶ See more
Eileen Lohan my problem is I‚Äôm healthy 76 year old, but I do have pain which means inflammation. I don‚Äôt really need to lose weight and still struggling with ‚Äúhealthy‚Äù
Janet Pirozzi
Eileen Lohan what does this mean?

After being told about this and researching for myself, I donated everything none Carnivore in my kitchen- if you don‚Äôt buy non carnivore wood then you can‚Äôt eat it! Once you see the weight loss and lack of brain fog you‚Äôll be totally motivated
Good luck

Take time to work into it! I needed about 2 weeks to adjust: to get used to my electolytes, to use cottage cheese to combat sugar cravings, to get used to eating fat with the meat, to get used to the texture of bone marrow in my eggs.
I recommend a slow transition..I‚Äôm week 11 and am still working into a total meat, butter, eggs, water, salt WOE. I have had excellent results and every week it gets easier.
Sugar addiction is worse than cocaine. You gotta give it 6 months and then smooth selling.
It might mean you‚Äôre just not ready yet.

Ribeyes and butter made it easy for me before that it was a struggle get all that fat in

It's not, and mostly just a mental weakness issue, but years of shitty eating also causes addictions that can be tough to kick. Just have to get your mind into the state of having the will power to treat your body well and not like a garbage dump

Dennis Welch again, love this .
.. "just have the will power to treat your body well and not like a rubbish dump".
It is easy. Just eat fatty meat, butter, eggs and bacon 2x a day till full!

My Pastor‚Äôs wife asked me if I was addicted to sugar and I said no. Years later I‚Äôm doing carnivore and I saw the power of the addiction. I was truly a sugar junkie and carnivore got me out of it.

No artificial sweeteners really helped me. I had no cravings after day 4. I also made my own spices with zero carbs. So mine is technically dirty carnivore. I also do dairy but am now easing away from that.
Buy steaks. Eat. Repeat.

Learn as much as you can before starting. Don‚Äôt believe it to be easy peasy research anything and everything that can go wrong so you can address and adjust accordingly if it should go wrong. I‚Äôve had many pitfalls, but most of them I was able to approach with knowledge üòâ
Not so hard when you realized the truth that most man made food is poison
i wud go keto and clean eating for awhile first. makes it so much easier.

It gets easier! Jump! If you fall down..get up and Jump again!! I haven't had a candy bar or crappy sides, in 3 weeks. You can do this. Sugar IS my addiction... the first 3 days are the worse....and the day after cheating...but keep going!!
You may be overthinking as I was.. had the just try it

You truly have to be in the mindset to do any change in any way of eating.
If you aren't there it will be difficult.
I started with a BBB&E Challenge with Neisha Salas-Berry, R.N. Ken Berry group (Tribe)ü•ìüßàü•©üç≥ in February of this year and I slowly having been adding in other Animal Foods since June
You just have to know WHY you‚Äôre doing it‚Ä¶ after that it‚Äôs easy

a medical exam woke me up. Found out I had a big fibroid and a cervical polyp. I fixed my diet immediately. I am now carnivore, eat less than 20 carbs a day, less than 1,200 calories a day, mostly steak and eggs. One cheat meal a week but even that is ‚Ä¶ See more

When I left myself have a little bit of sugar (carbs), it is ALWAYS hard... Once I actually cut it out completely, it literally gets easier and easier as each day passes. Also, learning to love MORE how you feel when you are doing this over how "good"‚Ä¶ See more
Just do it!

I really don't understand the struggle.
It's so very easy, satisfying and has instant results.
Make the decision and commit.
Life is so much easier now. I just throw some meat in a pan with butter or bacon grease. I love it!!!!!!
For me it‚Äôs all the heavy creams and butters. And of course my brain that has been promoting low carb Mediterranean diet for 35+ years!
It's called addiction, you are a sugar addict. It takes 6 months to get off of this sugar habit and your body to transform over to Fat burning Stay and be. strong.
Ask yourself WHY you want to do it and it will solve the problem.
Start with 1 meal at a time. Pay attention to how you‚Äôre feeling .
